alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 8:42PM CDT until May 21 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River At Mora affecting Kanabec County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Minnesota... Long Prairie River at Long Prairie affecting Todd County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin affecting Anoka and Hennepin Counties. Mississippi River at St. Cloud affecting Sherburne, Stearns and Wright Counties. Minnesota River At Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. Sauk River at St. Cloud affecting Stearns County. Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County. For the Minnesota River...including Montevideo, Dawson, Granite Falls HWY 212, Morton, New Ulm, Mankato, Henderson MN19, Jordan, Savage...Major flooding is forecast. For the Sauk River...including St. Cloud...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Mississippi River...including Royalton 4NW, St. Cloud, Hwy 169 at Champlin, Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk, Fridley abv 37th Ave NE, St. Paul, Hastings L/D 2, Red Wing L/D 3, Red Wing...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the REDWOOD RIVER...including Redwood Falls...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY, MAY 21... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin. * WHEN...Until Saturday, May 21. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Champlin - flooding begins on West River Parkway upstream from gage * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 730 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday morning to a crest of 13.4 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.4 feet on 04/15/2001. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
